data.text: @TonyMcKelvie @brawday Thank you. I apologise for my error.

@TonyMcKelvie @brawday I suggest you look at the ONS website. Their statistics are on PEOPLE who TEST positive. A sample of the population is taken and a figure for the entire population is deduced. If you don’t take a test you won’t test positive. Hence England’s figure.

@zexpe @TonyMcKelvie I suggest you get off your high horse and stop assuming people don't know stuff.

I know exactly how the ONS works.

That's why I don't rely on them as a credible source of facts.

Garbage In. Garbage Out.

@GREIGEXVS1300A @TonyMcKelvie I suggest you take a moment to learn about the ONS survey before tweeting. They take a consistent sample of people to test from various different geographic locations and ages to make an unbiased measurement of the true infection rate. Their testing is independent of policy. https://t.co/a7pfVnotL1
@GarySaddler2 @TonyMcKelvie Testing has all but stopped in England, not so in Scotland. The comparison is meaningless.

@TonyMcKelvie Means nothing when England ISN'T testing and recording Covid19 cases though does it?

It's the old computer programming statement of 'Garbage In, Garbage Out'.
